properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 9:40AM EST until February 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed rain and snow, changing to snow. Snow may be heavy
at times tonight. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches.
Locally higher amounts are possible. North winds becoming gusty
to 25 to 30 mph tonight.

* WHERE...Portions of southeast Virginia and northeast North
Carolina.

* WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow covered road conditions. The
hazardous conditions could impact the commutes this evening and
Friday morning as temperatures fall below freezing tonight.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

For the latest road conditions in Virginia or Maryland, please
call 5 1 1. For the latest road information in North Carolina, go
to http://DriveNC.gov.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY
